revised_title: Ragnar Granit: Pioneering Neurophysiologist and Vision Researcher
tldr: Ragnar Granit was a Finnish-Swedish neurophysiologist who made significant contributions to the understanding of vision and sensory processing. He discovered different types of units in the retina that corresponded to the colors blue, green, and red, and established that color vision in vertebrates depends on three separate channels. Granit's work laid the foundation for modern vision research and earned him a Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1967.
